meta.title: Operation of Tablet Punch and Die Set

sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the handling, maintenance, and storage of Tablet Punch and Die Sets.
sections.scope: Applicable to tablet tooling activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Inspect punches and dies for cleanliness and surface integrity upon receipt.
Ensure the tooling size and shape match the product specifications.
Clean the tooling with a soft cloth and appropriate cleaning agent.
Verify that punches move freely within the die bores.
Install the set into the tablet press carefully to avoid chipping edges.
After compression, remove the tooling and clean immediately.
Inspect for wear, corrosion, or 'black spots' on the punch tips.
Apply a thin layer of food-grade lubricant for storage.
Store the sets in designated, moisture-free storage boxes.
Update the tooling log with usage hours and condition.
precautions: Never use abrasive materials to clean punch tips.
Handle punches by the stem, avoiding the tip edges.
Do not store punches and dies together in a way that allows metal-on-metal contact.
Check for magnetism and demagnetize if necessary.
Follow strict numbering and tracking to prevent mixed sets.
